definition: to come back to one's hometown in silken robes (idiom); to return in glory
clothes/CL:件[jian4]/Kangxi radical 145
to dress/to wear/to put on (clothes)
brocade/embroidered work/bright
surname Huan
to pay back/to return
still/still in progress/still more/yet/even more/in addition/fairly/passably (good)/as early as/even/also/else
country or countryside/native place/home village or town/township (PRC administrative unit)

sentences.english: Anybody coming back home without achievements is a loser, " Hu said."
sentences.chinese: 若不能衣锦还乡，那他就是一个失败者。

sentences.english: Often these people are encouraged by the stories of the few who successfully return to their homelands in wealth and luxury.
sentences.chinese: 这些人往往从少数衣锦还乡者的故事受到鼓舞。

sentences.english: I'll come back with honors someday.
sentences.chinese: 有朝一日，我会衣锦还乡。

sentences.english: He left poor and later returned with ship coming home.
sentences.chinese: 他离开时贫穷，但后来衣锦还乡。

definition: to return home with honor
to come back to one's hometown in silken robes (idiom); to return in glory
to bring honor to one's ancestors
to win success and recognition (idiom)
splendor shines on the family's door (idiom)/fig. to bring honor to one's family
to return home/fig. to retire from public life
(of a deserving official) to grant his wife a title and make his son heir to his titles
to bring honor to one's ancestors (idiom)/also written 光宗耀祖
lit. the divine steed Feihuang gallops (idiom)/fig. to achieve meteoric success in one's career
to win top marks in the imperial examinations
to stand out among one's peers (idiom)/to excel
to visit one's parents
to return home with honor
to achieve or accomplish goals
a falling leaf returns to the roots (idiom); everything has its ancestral home/In old age, an expatriate longs to return home.
to remove armor and return to the farm/to return to civilian life
